meanings.definition: To change or move something slightly to make it more suitable or effective.
meanings.sent1: She was adjusting the picture frame on the wall.
meanings.sent2: He is adjusting the settings on his phone to make the screen brighter.
meanings.sent3: The cat was adjusting its position on the windowsill to get a better view of the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic was adjusting the engine, making sure every part was in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The dancer was adjusting her movements to match the rhythm of the music, creating a beautiful performance.

meanings.definition: To adapt or become accustomed to new conditions or circumstances.
meanings.sent1: After moving to a new country, she was adjusting to the different culture.
meanings.sent2: The students were adjusting to the new schedule after the summer break.
meanings.sent3: The robot was adjusting to its new programming, learning to perform tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent4: The plant was adjusting to the sunlight, growing stronger with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was adjusting to the high altitude, training hard to improve endurance.
